title: Neighbours pull out blanket to save girl, 3, dangling from 90ft from balcony

A young girl was luckily saved by neighbours when they saw her dangerously clinging onto a balcony 88 feet above the ground.

The three-year-old girl was left sleeping at home when her mother, known by the surname Wang, went out for grocery shopping in Nanning, Guangxi region of southwest China.

Neighbour Ms Xu heard the girl crying and looked up from her balcony to see the toddler girl dangling from the metal bars of the ninth floor, according to China News .

She then alerted a few other neighbours and ran to knock on the girl's home but no one answered the door.

(Image: Pear)

A neighbour tried to calm the girl and said in the video: "It's okay, it's okay. Your mum's coming back."

The group of neighbours then brought out a blanket in a bid to catch the girl if she fell.

The toddler is then seen trying to climb down to the floor below but is too scared to move any further.

Another group of neighbours then set up a second safety net on the ground floor.

At around 8.30am, Wang came home to see her daughter clinging outside the building and rushed to her aid along with the security guards.

The guards plied open the metal bars and pulled the girl to safety.

(Image: Pear)

The girl was found to be unharmed.

Wang explained to the media that her husband left home for work early in the morning and she went to take her elder child to school.

She claimed her daughter was sleeping when she left and did not expect she would climb outside on the balcony.
description: The girl walked onto the balcony to look for her mother but found herself dangling off the metal bars on the ninth floor of their home in southwest China
